title: Russia renews major missile attacks on Ukraine's energy infrastructure
description: A fresh barrage of deadly Russian strikes battered Ukraine on Friday, worsening dire conditions for Ukrainians after knocking out water and electricity in several regions. Kyiv warned of long cuts.

title: Three recipes from elsewhere for Christmas
description: In these homes, every Christmas is an international tour of tastes and flavors. To reconnect with roots, pay homage to a grandmother's dish and resurrect all those travel memories that linger on the tips of our tongues.

title: World Cup 2022: Gianni Infantino, FIFA's 'monarch' and big-money man
description: The Swiss-Italian president of FIFA is the only candidate in next year's election. He has secured his position by handing out subsidies and left his mark on the Qatar World Cup by aggressively criticizing the West.

title: Denis Mukwege, Nobel prize winner: 'We are calling for international mobilization against Rwanda's aggression in DRC'
description: Denis Mukwege denounces the double standards of the West in reference to the rapidity with which it sanctioned Russia over its invasion of Ukraine; this while holding back on sanctions against Rwanda, which Mr. Mukwege is calling for.

title: France and Morocco 'write new page' after visa spat
description: The two countries foreign minister's announced they had returned to 'full consular cooperation' after more than a year of tension.

title: Central African Republic: Parcel bomb wounds Russian official, Wagner chief blames France
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, the head of the Wagner mercenary group, said the wounded Russian had previously received threats.

title: Bangladesh: Economic downturn and authoritarianism spark wave of protests
description: Protesters and opponents demand that Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, who has abruptly ruled the country since 2009, stand down.

title: 1,500 fish die after huge Berlin aquarium burst
description: The aquarium was in the center of a hotel lobby, where some 300 guests who were staying at the Radisson Blu were evacuated.

title: World Cup 2022: Three France players ill ahead of final
description: Raphaël Varane, Ibrahima Konaté and Kingsley Coman all missed training on Friday.

title: EU leaders agree on new sanctions against Russia, but still no consensus on subsidy package
description: Meeting in Brussels, European leaders agreed on a ninth package of sanctions against Russia, but plans for a green subsidy package, in response to the US Inflation Reduction Act, remain vague at best.

title: Germany struggles to modernize its army
description: The German Parliament backed a €13 billion envelope to modernize the Bundeswehr, but it will be insufficient to reach the 2% of GDP target required by NATO.

title: Fire kills 10 near Lyon: Apartment building was 'rundown,' say local authorities
description: The suburban Lyon neighborhood where 10 people, including 5 children, died in the fire is part of a multi-million euro urban renovation project after years of urban decay and crime.

title: Rugby ethics body demands convicted Laporte resign from French federation
description: Bernard Laporte, the head of French rugby, was found guilty of corruption earlier this week – nine months before France hosts the World Cup final.

title: Inflation, social movements: Will 2023 be a dangerous year for Macron?
description: The start of the new year could see a surge in discontent, as gas and electricity prices rise and the government presents its pension reform, analyzes 'Le Monde' journalist Audrey Tonnelier in her column.

title: COP15 negotiators divided over biodiversity fund
description: Environment ministers from some 110 countries kickstarted a decisive round of negotiations in Montreal on Thursday, December 15.

title: French government overrules Parliament for tenth time to pass budget
description: Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne triggered a procedure to force the final draft of the budget through Parliament with no vote. In response, the left-wing opposition alliance tabled yet another motion of no-confidence.

title: 2022 saw unprecedented growth for French agriculture
description: In 2022, the value of France's national agricultural production increased by 17.4% to reach just under €100 billion.

title: Twitter: Outcry after Musk suspends journalists' accounts due to their criticism
description: The billionaire recently took control of the social network, claiming that he would protect freedom of expression. He claims that the reporters broadcast his position in real time, placing his family in danger. Not true, says 'The Washington Post.'

title: Who are the far-right activists arrested in Paris after the France-Morocco game?
description: Thirty-eight people were arrested after the World Cup semi-final. They belong to the far right, according to investigators. Searches reveal detailed preparations for violence.

title: France: Ten people, including five children, killed in apartment building fire near Lyon
description: At 6:30 am, French police released a statement saying that a 'sizeable fire' broke out in an apartment block in Vaulx-en-Velin.

title: Malaysia landslide at campsite leaves holidaymakers dead and dozens missing
description: Authorities are scrambling to rescue people who may be buried in the mud.

title: After 'Qatargate,' European Parliament President seeks to remedy 'systemic' flaws
description: Roberta Metsola launched a ten-point plan to restore the Parliament's credibility and address the shortcomings highlighted by the Belgian judicial investigation.

title: The French economy ends the year on a negative note
description: France should escape a recession however thanks to an uptick in activity in early 2023.

title: 'Qataris have perfectly understood the role of worldwide spectator sports in the making of the image of a country'
description: The richest emerging countries are using international sports as a weapon of influence to accumulate global economic and political influence.

title: Pensions: The cursed reform that has haunted Macron for five years
description: The postponement of the bill's presentation risks making the president look weak, or even indecisive, something which would be politically costly.

title: Twitter suspends journalists who cover Elon Musk
description: Journalists suspended include reporters working for The New York Times, Washington Post, CNN and other publications.

title: Peru: Judge orders 18 month detention for ousted president Castillo
description: Meanwhile, supporters of the ousted president have continued to protest across the country.

title: The European Union adopts a 15 % tax on multinational businesses
description: On Thursday, the EU passed the landmark agreement intended to stop governments racing to cut taxes to lure the world's richest firms to their territory.
